metadata.Title: CVE-2022-1729 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - low
metadata.Description:
A race condition was found the Linux kernel in perf_event_open() which canbe exploited by an unprivileged user to gain root privileges. The bugallows to build several exploit primitives such as kernel addressinformation leak, arbitrary execution, etc.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-1729` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.15.0-191-generic - 4.15.0-191.202
linux-image-4.15.0-191-generic-lpae - 4.15.0-191.202
linux-image-4.15.0-191-lowlatency - 4.15.0-191.202
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-191-generic - 4.15.0-191.202
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-191-lowlatency - 4.15.0-191.202
No subscription required

linux-image-5.4.0-126-generic - 5.4.0-126.142~18.04.1
linux-image-5.4.0-126-generic-lpae - 5.4.0-126.142~18.04.1
linux-image-5.4.0-126-lowlatency - 5.4.0-126.142~18.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-126-generic - 5.4.0-126.142~18.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-126-lowlatency - 5.4.0-126.142~18.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-1125-kvm - 4.15.0-1125.130
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1139-aws - 4.15.0-1139.150
No subscription required

No subscription required

No subscription required

No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-191.202').
linux-hwe: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'replaced by linux-hwe-5.4').
